description:
Souya Kuroi has dreams of people with superpowers fighting a massive dragon in the sky, but his real life is almost as weird. He's had amnesia for about two weeks and been taken in by a maid and an anthropomorphic cat. When a UFO in the shape of a stuffed bear approaches Sorimasaka City and other metros around the world, he's startled to see seven rainbow-sparkling heroes zoom out to confront it – just like in his dream. Even weirder, the maid wants him to leave his shelter to confront these heroes and take the source of their power.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nekogaeru)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nekogaeru)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nekogaeru)
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/192376/)._
President and CEO of [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

The founder and representative director of [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

In 1976, Miyata joined [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/), and was assigned to the planning and literature department. Three years later he moved to being a producer.  After having left Tatsunoko he joined [Kitty Film](https://anilist.co/studio/99/) for some time before founding J.C. Staff in 1986.

After producing numerous works for J.C. Staff in the late '80s and throughout the '90s - he shifted his focus to a more managerial position in 2000, a position which he still holds to this day while serving as the studio's representative director.
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where she is one of the sub-leaders.
